newsitem.title: USA: Discovery Communications buys Lancit stake.
newsitem.headline: Discovery Communications buys Lancit stake.

text.p: Discovery Communications Inc said it purchased 6.6 percent of Lancit Media Productions Ltd and may purchase an additional 6.2 percent.
Discovery also said it will fully fund the development and production costs of approved and newly developed Lancit children's programming, interstitial elements and promotional spots for Discovery.

Discovery said it made an initial $5 million investment in Lancit, acquiring 6.6 percent stake, representing 438,116 shares valued at $11.41 per share, and four year warrants to purchase an additional 438,116 shares at $13.00 per share.

Discovery is a Bethesda, Md.-based media company whose businesses include cable television's Discovery Channel and retailing's The Nature Company, which is owned by Liberty Media Corp, a division of Tele-Communications Inc , Cox Communications Inc, Advance/Newhouse Communications and John S. Hendricks, the company's founder and chief executive.
"This investment makes strategic sense for two reasons -- as the next step in our company's plans to move aggressively across multiple platforms into the children's marketplace.
"And as a signal that we are actively seeking production partners across a wide range of programming genres with varying target audiences," said Discovery President Judith McHale.
She said the partnership with Lancit Media is expected to enhance Discovery's recently announced expansion plans into the children's marketplace by creating programming for:
-- a Sunday morning block of children's programs on Discovery Channel debuting in early 1997;
-- a new 24-hour cable and satellite-delivered channel, Discovery Kids, beginning Oct. 20, 1996; and
-- a Discovery Kids network in Latin America, to launch in November 1996.
Lancit's programs could also strengthen The Learning Channel's award-winning week-day morning programming block entitled Ready, Set, Learn!, McHale said.
Allen & Co Inc initiated the proposed alliance and is acting as financial advisor to Lancit Media.
"The Discovery alliance addresses several strategic objectives that were articulated when we first commenced discussions with Allen & Co," said Lancit chief executive Cecily Truett.

"The partnership will provide access to a valuable airing venue for future Lancit-produced programs as well as a source of equity capital and positive cash flow to support future growth." -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.
